phrases: And we broke
Everything that was right
We both enjoyed a good fight
And we sewed
All the holes we had to breathe
To make the other one leave
And I loved
The way you looked at me
And I miss
The way you made me feel
When we were alone
When we were alone
And I will shiver like I used to
And I will leave him just for you
And I will shiver like I used to
Mushi-Shi
Mushi-Shi
Just for you
Like I used to
In the mountains, toward the end of winter,
a deep, quiet, whisper-like sound may be heard.
Hm?
Should not be long now.
It heralds the awakening of the mountain's springtime mushi.
It is the sound of the quiet voices of the mountain lords discussing when to have the awakening.
The Depths of Winter
Damn.
I was hoping to cross this River of Light before the mushi awaken...
but it sounds like they will come earlier than expected this year.
Newly awakened, hungry mushi are such a pain to deal with.
Looks like I will not be able to make it there just yet.
It was not particularly urgent anyway.
I will just hole myself up here for a few days.
It is still pretty cold...
but by the time I wake up, spring should be here.
I wonder if the coast is clear yet.
It is oddly quiet, though.
Huh?
What the hell?
Damn.
Did I misread the signs somehow?
Just what is going on here?
The snow should have thawed by now.
The wind-whistling Oroshibue are still here...
though I guess they do not look like they are at their full midwinter strength.
There is no snow left on the next mountain over.
Does it get more sunlight than this one?
Hm?
That is...
Those Oroshibue are migrating.
They are going back north.
The flock here is not joining them yet?
Huh?
I doubled back somehow.
I have been heading downhill the whole time, so why am I still walking in circles?
The mountain has been sealed.
There was nothing amiss on the mountain when I arrived, though.
Damn.
Well, that explains why winter mushi like the Oroshibue have not migrated yet.
What in the world happened here?
I should go ask the mountain lord.
I... cannot hear his voice anymore.
Even the mountain's Mugura are nowhere to be found.
Maybe I will try using kouki to summon him.
On second thought,
I do not know exactly what is happening here, so I would better not.
Serpent Lord

Serpent Lord
Map of the River of Light
Serpent Lord
Hm...
Who is the lord here?
Map of the River of Light
Serpent Lord
Well, I am sure I will run into him if I follow the stream.
I would better get to it right away.
It is not just the lord I cannot find.
There is not a single beast in sight.
But now that I am taking a closer look,
there are signs of landslides throughout the mountain.
They must have happened during the typhoons back in autumn.
They did a lot of damage.
Did the lord seal the entire mountain
and force it to hibernate so that it could heal its wounds?
But when in a weakened state, hibernation can just as easily kill as it can save.
In the next mountain over, it is already spring...
but this one has yet to awaken.
From the looks of it, this mountain is at death's door.
And if I do not find a way out of here, I may share its fate.
Hm?
Something over there was watching me just now.
The water here somehow is not frozen over.
Hm?
The mountain lord!
Hey!
Hey, Mountain Lord!
Just how long do you plan on keeping the mountain sealed?
Should not you just give up now?
It is already spring everywhere else!
Hm?
What is with them?
They are flocking together.
They are heading toward me!
What is with this swamp?
It is bottomless!
What is this place?
It seems like mud,
and yet I can breathe.
Everyone is asleep down here?
There is kouki bubbling up from the bottom, too.
So everyone is been here healing themselves the whole time.
I see now.
So the mountain was not dead after all.
Thank goodness.
I am glad.
It is... finally spring?
Hm?
The Oroshibue are still here, though.
My kouki...
Hey, stop that!
They are finally migrating.
The mountain is no longer sealed.
Huh?
Crap.
It is starting.
Damn.
The mushi tobacco's probably ruined now too.
Either way, I would better hurry.
I made it out.
That was easier than I thought it would be, though.
Maybe it is because the mountain's not back to its full strength?
Or is it possible that the mountain lord restrained the mushi?
In any case, I cannot believe I lost everything, including my kouki.
Then again, it did go to helping those weakened Oroshibue migrate.
Wait a minute.
Did he let me into the mountain...
just to get at my kouki?
So, was all that...
orchestrated by the mountain lord?
No matter.
It is spring, now.
Winter departs.
The mountains laugh.
The meadows awaken in splendor.
Mushi-Shi The Next Chapter
